featured.text: At approximately the same time, the Earl of Sandwich popularized a new way of eating bread—in thin slices, with something (e.g., jam or cucumbers) between them.
Some words, such as “sandwich” and “hamburger,” were ______
The Earl of Sandwich started the afternoon tea ceremony.
Before long, a small meal at the end of the afternoon, involving tea and sandwiches, had become part of the British way of life.

definition.zh_def: 夾心麵包，通常由兩片麵包和中間的餡料組成。
definition.en_def: A food item consisting of two pieces of bread with filling in between.
definition.example: I had a turkey sandwich for lunch.
